citation.article-title: Hippea maritima gen. nov., sp. nov., a new genus of thermophilic, sulfur-reducing bacterium from submarine hot vents.

p.s: Hippea (Hip'pea. L. fem. n. after Hans Hippe, a German microbiologist, in recognition of his significant contribution to the characterization of new, obligately anaerobic prokaryotes and the understanding of their physiology)
Metabolize by reduction of elemental sulfur.
Capable of lithotrophic growth with H2 and sulfur.
Oxidize completely volatile fatty acids, fatty acids and alcohols.
Growth products are CO2 and H2S.
The G + C content of the DNA of the type strain of the type species is 40 mol%.
The type species is Hippea maritima.
